results.title: Country is my life
results.creator_credit: John Lovett, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Johnnie Lovett endeavours to express his love for country music, how it feeds his spirit and the people who have inspired and encouraged him to become a musician in the first place.

results.title: Pitcha this : memories of Fitzroy : Foundation for Young Australians : Digital Storytelling project
results.creator_credit: May Andy, Marlene Scerri, Kelvin Onus-King, Howard Edwards, Frances Gallagher, Deborah Deacon, Arika Waulu, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Seven Indigenous leaders in the community tell of growing up in Fitzroy. From disperate backgrounds, they have all become heavily involved with the activism and community spirit of Fitzroy in Melbourne, to grow into inspirational leaders for generations to come. Here they share their experiences and passions, as well as the families and communities they love.
results.title_for_label: Pitcha this : memories of Fitzroy : Foundation for Young Australians : Digital Storytelling project
results.creator_credit_for_label: May Andy, Marlene Scerri, Kelvin Onus-King, Howard Edwards, Frances Gallagher, Deborah Deacon, Arika Waulu, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Seven Indigenous leaders in the community tell of growing up in Fitzroy. From disperate backgrounds, they have all become heavily involved with the activism and community spirit of Fitzroy in Melbourne, to grow into inspirational leaders for generations to come. Here they share their experiences and passions, as well as the families and communities they love.
description_for_label: Seven Indigenous leaders in the community tell of growing up in Fitzroy. From disperate backgrounds, they have all become heavily involved with the activism and community spirit of Fitzroy in Melbourne, to grow into inspirational leaders for generations to come. Here they share their experiences and passions, as well as the families and communities they love.

results.title: Pitcha this : life stories from A.S.H.E (Shepparton) : Digital Storytelling project
results.creator_credit: Natasha Craig, Troy Lovett, Chris Mansfield, Daniel McCrimmon, Brian Beckhurst, Misty Briggs, Joel Atkinson, Tammy-Lee Atkinson, Helen Atkinson, VicHealth, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Nine stories of the lives of students from Shepparton’s A.S.H.E (Academy of Sport, Health and Education), as created by the students as part of ACMI’s Digital Storytelling program. These students, also members of the Indigenous community, tell of their loves, ambitions and, mostly, of the family that support and sustain them.
results.title_for_label: Pitcha this : life stories from A.S.H.E (Shepparton) : Digital Storytelling project
results.creator_credit_for_label: Natasha Craig, Troy Lovett, Chris Mansfield, Daniel McCrimmon, Brian Beckhurst, Misty Briggs, Joel Atkinson, Tammy-Lee Atkinson, Helen Atkinson, VicHealth, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: To my dearest son Mileak
results.creator_credit: Natasha Craig, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Even though Natasha Craig was pregnant at age 15, she was determined to have her child and embrace her new life as a mother. With the support of her family, she has been able to do so and doesn’t regret her decision as she sets up her life for her and her son.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Natasha Craig, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Even though Natasha Craig was pregnant at age 15, she was determined to have her child and embrace her new life as a mother. With the support of her family, she has been able to do so and doesn’t regret her decision as she sets up her life for her and her son.
